item.title: Patrick add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "The world is little, people are little, human life is little. There is only one big thing — desire." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "Not one of your pertinent ancestors was squashed, devoured, drowned, starved, stranded, stuck fast, untimely wounded, or otherwise deflected from its life's quest of delivering a tiny charge of genetic material to the right partner at the right moment in order to perpetuate the only possible sequence of hereditary combinations that could result -- eventually, astoundingly, and all too briefly -- in you." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Patrick add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Stefan Zweig
item.description: "Time to leave now, get out of this room, go somewhere, anywhere; sharpen this feeling of happiness and freedom, stretch your limbs, fill your eyes, be awake, wider awake, vividly awake in every sense and every pore." -- Stefan Zweig

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "It isn't what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats." -- Voltaire

item.title: Patrick add a quote by George Saunders
item.description: "Don't be afraid to be confused. Try to remain permanently confused. Anything is possible. Stay open, forever, so open it hurts, and then open up some more, until the day you die, world without end, amen." -- George Saunders

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Two possibilities exist: either we are alone in the Universe or we are not. Both are equally terrifying." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "Remember the quiet wonders. The world has more need of them than it has for warriors." -- Charles de Lint

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Isaac Newton
item.description: "If I have seen further it is by standing on the shoulders of Giants." -- Isaac Newton

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "A book lying idle on a shelf is wasted ammunition." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Mortimer J. Adler
item.description: "True freedom is impossible without a mind made free by discipline." -- Mortimer J. Adler

item.title: Patrick add a quote by George Santayana
item.description: "Sanity is a madness put to good uses." -- George Santayana

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Ogden Nash
item.description: "Tonight’s December thirty-first, Something is about to burst. The clock is crouching, dark and small, Like a time bomb in the hall. Hark, it's midnight, children dear. Duck! Here comes another year!" -- Ogden Nash

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Baltasar Gracian
item.description: "Never open the door to a lesser evil, for other and greater ones invariably slink in after it." -- Baltasar Gracian

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Alan Watts
item.description: "Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth." -- Alan Watts

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Osip Mandelstam
item.description: "My turn shall also come: I sense the spreading of a wing." -- Osip Mandelstam

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "My library is an archive of longings." -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I have great faith in fools - self-confidence my friends will call it." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Patrick add a quote by R.A. Salvatore
item.description: "It is better, I think, to grab at the stars than to sit flustered because you know you cannot reach them." -- R.A. Salvatore

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "There comes a time when one must take a position that is neither safe, nor politic, nor popular, but he must take it because conscience tells him it is right." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Derek Walcott
item.description: "The time will come when, with elation, you will greet yourself arriving at your own door, in your own mirror, and each will smile at the other’s welcome." -- Derek Walcott

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "Set wide the window. Let me drink the day." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Lock up your libraries if you like; but there is no gate, no lock, no bolt that you can set upon the freedom of my mind." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "I'd rather sing one wild song and burst my heart with it, than live a thousand years watching my digestion and being afraid of the wet." -- Jack London

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "This was another of our fears: that Life wouldn't turn out to be like Literature." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Patrick add a quote by Romain Rolland
item.description: "Be reverent before the dawning day. Do not think of what will be in a year, or in ten years. Think of to-day." -- Romain Rolland
